questions.question: 1. When an external magnetic field is applied, what happens to the protons in the sample?

answers.a: All protons align with the field.
answers.b: All protons align opposite to the field.
answers.c: Some protons align with the field and some align opposite to it.
answers.d: All protons assume a random orientation.

explanations.a: Almost half of the protons align along the field.
explanations.b: Almost half of the protons align opposite to the field.
explanations.c: It is true that some protons align along and some align opposite the field and this difference in the number causes the signal to occur.
explanations.d: None of the protons assume random orientation. They either align along or opposite the field.

questions.question: 2. Which of the following is false about NMR experiment?

answers.a: The energy required to flip the spin of a proton is in the infrared region of the electromagnetic spectrum.
answers.b: The energy difference between the two spin states depends on the strength of the magnetic field.
answers.c: When energy absorption occurs, the nuclei are said to be in resonance with the electromagnetic radiation.
answers.d: When a proton is aligned with the magnetic field, its energy is lower than when it is aligned against the magnetic field.

explanations.a: The energy required to flip the spin of a proton mostly falls in the radiowave region.
explanations.b: The splitting of the spin states depends on the strength of the magnetic field applied. Stronger magnetic field will split them more.
explanations.c: When the protons absorb energy and undergo flipping, they are known to be in resonance with the incoming radiowave frequency.
explanations.d: Protons aligned along the field have lower energy while those aligned opposite the field have higher energy.

questions.question: 3. What is the value of the chemical shift Î´ for an absorption at 1800 Hz from tetramethylsilane (TMS) using an NMR spectrometer with an operating frequency of 300 MHz?

explanations.c: chemical shift = (frequency of absorption / frequency of operation ) ppm

questions.question: 4. Which of the following compounds has the MOST deshielded methyl protons?

explanations.a: Deshielding depends upon the electron withdrawing power of the attached atoms/group. Silicon has low electronegativity due to which it cannot withdraw much of the electron towards itself from the C-H bond.
explanations.b: Fluorine has the highest electronegativity in the periodic table due to which it will withdraw the electrons from the C-H bond by the highest amount among these.
explanations.c: Oxygen is lower in electronegativity than Fluorine and hence the methyl protons will be less deshielded than with F.
explanations.d: Nitrogen is much lower in electronegativity than Fluorine and hence the methyl protons will be less deshielded than with F.

questions.question: 5. How many signals would the following molecule show in its 1H NMR spectrum?

explanations.a: The number of signals depend on the number of non - equivalent protons (H) in the molecule. In this molecule, there are 5 different types of protons namely CH&#83233, CH&#83232, ortho H, meta H and para H.
